intro: Haplocarpha schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian daisy, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers bloom in shades of yellow and white. Haplocarpha schimperi is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
